Package network

network is a package that provides representations of a network in terms of Links and Nodes.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Constants
    A class encapsulating constants to be used throughout the project.
    DeferredSchedulingNode<T extends Message>
    A node that routes messages by referring to a scheduler.
    FIFOScheduler<T extends Message>
    Implements a FIFO scheduler.
    Flow<T extends Message>
    Represents a sequence of hops between a source and a destination.
    InputLink<T extends Message>
    Implements a WrapperLink that only permits usage of a Link for receiving data.
    Link<T extends Message>
    Represents a link that can: Send a Message of type T from the source Receive a Message of type T at the sink Determine whether it is busy or otherwise unable to transmit Determine which Nodes are connected to this link.
    Message
    Acts as a generic message that can be sent through a network.
    Network<T extends Message>  
    Node<T extends Message>
    An abstract class that provides the basic functionality of a network node.
    OutputLink<T extends Message>
    Implements a WrapperLink that only permits usage of a Link for transmitting data.
    ParallelScheduler<T extends Message>  
    QueuedLink<T extends Message>
    A link that implements transmission and reception according to the ordering constraints outlined in Link.transmit(int, Message) and Link.receive(int).
    Scheduler<T extends Message>
    Defines the abstract functionality of a scheduler, and provides support for a decision structure.
    Switch<T extends Message>
    Implements a schedule-based switch.
    VOQScheduler<T extends Message>
    Implements a scheduler that uses VOQs.
    WrapperLink<T extends Message>
    A Link that is used to wrap around another Link.

Package network Description

network is a package that provides representations of a network in terms of Links and Nodes.

The network Links are used to abstract away details of concurrency from the network Nodes.
